question: ... I don't have time to get a warrant from some hung-over judge. Just give me the go-ahead, Victor, and I promise -- as soon as this is over -- you can brand my butt with the Fourth Amendment. Tell her to hang on --
answer: A jet was chartered at Anderson Airfield. Guess who just showed up to pay for it? Pollux Troy.

question: Scramble the Reaction Team -- we're moving out. And get one of our people on that plane.
answer: But there's still no sign of Castor...

question: You're 26 minutes late. The casing didn't fit -- right? I knew that cheap-shit Dietrich would rip us off...
answer: Oh, God -- !

question: What!?
answer: I forgot to turn the damn thing on!

question: You're kidding, right? He's kidding... ... are you fucking kidding!?
answer: Bro -- everything went fine.

question: I hate when you call me bro.
answer: Thanks for babysitting. I'll contact you when we get the rest of the money. Oh, and stat away from downtown. The inversion layer's going to be pretty thick around the 18th. Let's go, let's go! Hell, yes... It's the only way to fly. What's wrong? It's Archer. Go, dammit!

question: That's what you always say. Seal it off. I'm going in.
answer: Jon, I'm getting a little annoyed by your obsessive need to spoil my fun.

question: And how much will your 'fun' net you this time?
answer: What's it to you? I declare it. Here I am, back in the States for less than a week --

question: You're under arrest. Incredibly, you still have the right to remain silent --
answer: I've got something going down on the eighteenth... it's gonna be worse than anything God ever dumped on the Pharaoh. I'll give it up -- but my brother and I have to walk.

question: No discussion -- no deals.
answer: What're you gonna do with me locked up? You'll drive your wife and kid nuts! I bet your daughter is just about ripe by now. What's her name, Janie?

question: Well, you tried. You failed miserably, but you tried.
answer: Why won't she even talk to me?

question: Maybe because you taught her never to speak to strangers. I'm sorry... that wasn't fair. I've got patients waiting. Try again, Jon. She hates you -- but she needs you.
answer: Eve...

question: Jon -- what is it? Is it -- him? It's... it's over?
answer: I'm going to make everything up to you and Jamie. I'll put in for a desk job. We'll go away, get counseling -- anything you want. This time, I mean it. Much appreciated. Now let's get back to work, okay?

question: Send it back and tell them to stop wasting the taxpayers' money. Anything else, Miss Brewster? How's Loomis?
answer: He needs some surgery, but he's going to be okay. That's the good news...

question: Go on.
answer: ... Brodie and Miller from Special Ops need to see you.

question: He's lying.
answer: He's hooked up to a full-spectrum polygraph.

question: Pollux is a manipulative psychopath. He can control his heartbeat, his sweat glands, his blood pressure...
answer: Jon, I trust your instincts, I always have. But D.C. wants more evidence. And frankly, so do I.

question: You'll get all the evidence you need when ten thousand people die.
answer: We'll get a team right on it. But we can't evacuate the city on what amounts to a hunch.

question: That bomb has been built, it's out there somewhere and it's going to detonate...
answer: Didn't Castor give any clue where the bomb might be?

question: Only one person knows -- his brother Pollux. And he'll keep his mouth shut until it blows.
answer: We could plant an agent in his cell -- get him to spill the location.

question: Pollux is way too paranoid. The only person he'd talk to about that bomb is Castor himself. And dead men can't talk.
answer: There might be a way around that...

question: I'm in a hurry, Dietrich. So you've only got ten seconds to go through your usual litany of lies, empty threats, and moronic denials. Then I'm coming over there --
answer: If you're in such a fucking hurry -- why are you wasting your time with me? I'm just an art dealer.

question: You're a dealer, all right
answer: You've never proven any of that. And when my bitchy, never-been- laid femi-nazi lawyer gets here, she's going to...

question: When was the last time you saw Castor Troy?
answer: Who cares? He's dead.

question: Answer the question.
answer: Look, I'm clean. I teach kids now --

question: Sasha -- you are a felon, on probation for harboring Castor Troy. So it's in your best interest to cooperate. Would you like your son put in a foster home?
answer: No, but I'm sure you'd love it -- you sick bastard.

question: When was the last time you saw Castor Troy?
answer: I haven't seen him for years.

question: I'm in.
answer: I was dreaming...

question: Something good?
answer: I'm not sure... you were flying this weird old stunt plane... doing flips... walking on the wings... I was watching from the ground -- when you fell. You had a parachute, but you wouldn't open it.

question: Did you catch me?
answer: No.

question: How come?
answer: I don't know... Maybe because you've never needed my help.

question: Come on, you made that up, didn't you?
answer: ... Maybe I did... ... maybe I didn't... It's all right, Jon.

question: After all these years, I still can't get it out of my head -- an inch to the left, Matty would still be alive.
answer: And you wouldn't be. Things will get better now that you're home. Everything will be better -- now that... that man is finally out of our lives.

question: Eve... ... If I had to do something to find some closure... I should do it, shouldn't I?... No matter how crazy?
answer: Oh, God -- you're going on assignment again...

question: One last time. And while I'm gone, I want you and Jamie to go to your mother's. It's important...
answer: You said you'd be here! You promised! What could be more important than that?

question: I can't tell you... except only I can do it.
answer: You want me to tell you it's okay to leave? Okay, go on! Go!

question: Keep this for me.
answer: Let's walk through it, Jon. Your blood types are different, but we can't do anything about that. Otherwise, nature is cooperating nicely. The height difference is negligible -- within 1/2 an inch. Eye color -- almost a perfect match. Penis size, flaccid, essentially the same -- Substantial. Hairline will be adjusted with laser-shears... micro-plugs for the body hair... the teeth will be bonded to match Castor's... How about an abdominoplasty?

question: Abdomino -- what?
answer: A tummy tuck. On the house.

question: Don't forget -- I ordered a kosher meal...
answer: You are now an Erewhon inmate -- a citizen of nowhere. Human rights zealots, the Geneva convention and the P.C. police have no authority here. You have no right... When I say your ass belongs to me -- I mean it. Bend over. Step into them. Don't sniff 'em, you perv. Just step into them.

question: They're too tight.
answer: So's a noose. Now keep your mouth shut. The prison's one big magnetic field. The boots'll tell us where you are -- every second of the day. 201 to Population. I've got fifty bucks says you're dead by dinner. Don't disappoint me.

question: Do I look wasted -- asshole?
answer: Hold that lock down.

question: Never -- in -- the -- face.
answer: Lock 'em down.

question: What? He started it! When I get out of here --
answer: You'll what?

question: I'm going to have you fired.
answer: That's two strikes, Dubov. One more and you know where you're going. Back to your 'suites' -- or no dinner.

question: It's like they're begging us to riot. Where the fuck are we, anyway? Gotta go... ... I'm worried about you.
answer: Why?

question: Your jumpshot has no arc. You used to swagger... now you swish. You're gumming that butt like a Catholic school girl. And why do you keep picking at your finger?
answer: I was in a coma... My reflexes, my senses, my memory... everything's jumbled. I can't even tell you why Dubov jumped me yesterday.

question: You Pollinated his wife the day he was arrested. How could forget that?
answer: I've forgotten plenty. Look around -- we've screwed over half the freaks in here. What's gonna happen to us if they think I've lost it? I need you to play big brother for once -- till I can fill in a few blanks. Think you can handle that? I know I got this on my tenth birthday. I just can't remember why.

question: Man -- that was the worst day of our lives!
answer: Oh, God -- Mom O-D'd at County General.

question: Retching and convulsing while those bastards didn't even try to save her sorry ass. You gave her mouth to mouth -- man -- even then you had some constitution. Remember what you swore to me at the funeral?
answer: Uh -- to kill the doctors?

question: After that. You promised you'd always take care of me.
answer: And I bet I kept that promise...

question: Only one you've never broken.
answer: Screw the past. We've got the future to look forward to. We still have tomorrow.

question: No shit... five million bucks... now those Red Militia crackpots get to keep it.
answer: That's not the worst part.

question: What's worse than losing five million bucks?
answer: Being stuck in this rat-hole when it blows. What you built was a work of art. It belongs in the Smithsonian.

question: Yeah -- well... the L.A. Convention Center will have to do...
answer: Thanks, Pollux.

question: -- Castor...?
answer: Not anymore.

question: It can't be. It's impossible.
answer: I believe the phrase Dr. Hoag used was 'titanically remote'. Who knows? Maybe the trauma of having my face cut off pulled me out. Or maybe God really is on my side after all. By the way, I know you don't get the papers in here. Terrible tragedy. Hoag was such a genius -- but selfish with his artistry. I actually had to torture his assistants to convince him to perform the same surgery on me.

question: You killed them?
answer: Of course I killed them, you dumb fuck. Hoag, his staff... Miller and Brodie -- I even paid a visit to your buddy Tito.

question: He doesn't know anything about this!
answer: Come on, Jon. I think I know you better than that. I only wish you could have been there to see the look on his face -- -- then again, I guess you were there. I torched every shred of evidence that proves who you are. So swallow this -- you are going to be in here for the rest of your life.

question: Castor, don't do this --
answer: No discussion, Jon -- no deals. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got an important government job to abuse, and a beautiful wife to fuck. Excuse me -- I mean 'make love to.'

question: Better be nice, Castor. You could get mighty lonely now that Pollux is gone.
answer: Pollux is -- what?

question: Archer cut him a deal for turning state's evidence. He's been released...
answer: Walton, you have to listen to me -- right now!

question: Jesus, what a life.
answer: I suppose it was only a matter of time before you forgot where we lived.

question: Sorry -- the job's been murder lately.
answer: So what happened to your 'important' assignment?

question: What do you know about it?
answer: I know exactly what you always tell me

question: It didn't work out the way everyone thought it would. Where are you off to?
answer: I've got surgery.

question: Surgery -- are you okay?
answer: Don't try to charm me -- I'm still angry. There're leftovers in the fridge.

question: Have fun at work.
answer: What is with you?

question: Don't I usually kiss my wife?
answer: No.

question: What a dump. '... "Date-night" has been a typical failure... we haven't made love in almost two months...' What a loser ... The plot thickens.
answer: -- I got your E-mail, Karl. That poem was really sweet -- Hang on a sec... I'll call you back. You're not respecting my boundaries.

question: I'm coming in, Janie.
answer: 'Janie'?

question: I don't think you heard me... Jamie... You have something I want ...
answer: Clarissa left those here.

question: I won't tell mom if you don't.
answer: When did you start smoking?

question: You're supposed to be snitching -- making me look good.
answer: 'Look good'? Seeing that face -- I want to vomit.

question: I'm the one who has to look at this butt-ugly mug every time I pass a mirror. Look at my eyes, my chin, my perfect nose -- gone! Archer took my life, so I'm taking his. Bro, I'm going straight.
answer: Sounds like they took your brain, too?

question: Imagine Dillinger as J. Edgar Hoover. Carlos the Jackal running Interpol. Kaddafi heading the Mossad. Think of the secrets we could sell...
answer: The drug agents we could expose. The movie stars we could blackmail!

question: That's just the bottom of the food chain. Pollux -- what would happen if somebody planted a bomb on Air Force One?
answer: ... that somebody would get rich. And, I suppose, the nation would be pretty pissed-off.

question: Pissed-off, vulnerable... looking for someone to step in, take charge, give them hope again. What if that someone was an F.B.I. hero? A true Boy Scout and family man -- with a spotless past. Imagine where that guy could land -- if the timing's right.
answer: It's an audacious dream, Caz. But Jon Archer is hardly a household name.

question: Jon, your career is finally taking of. Archer. Sure I'll hold... Mr. President, what an honor... How about a game of horse?
answer: Don't make me beat your butt again, Dad. It's harmful to my developing psyche.

question: Afraid you'll lose? Try putting a higher arc on the ball... and square your shoulders to the basket.
answer: Gotta go. Karl's here.

question: Don't tell me you forgot. Eve -- it's date night!
answer: Why do I feel like I'm on a blind date?

question: It's important to keep some mystery... so things stay... unpredictable.
answer: 'Unpredictable'? You're about as unpredictable as the tide. How long are you going to be gone this time?

question: Gone?
answer: Isn't that what all this is about? The wine, cooking me dinner -- your next assignment?

question: I'm not going anywhere.
answer: You always say that -- then you leave.

question: I bet I deserved that. I bet Jon Archer is the most inattentive, sexless spouse on Earth.
answer: Jon, that's not true --

question: Of course it's true, but I'm trying to change? I'm here because I want to be alone with you. I want to see the candle- light dance in your beautiful -- -- brown eyes. I wanted it all to be just right... when I told you about my promotion.
answer: Your what?

question: Well, I don't have it yet. But Lazarro's getting old -- he won't be around forever. And I'm getting the itch to move up.
answer: Jon... that's wonderful.

question: Don't they ever let us take off these boots?
answer: Not unless you're sent to the 'Clinic.'

question: You mean if I get sick?
answer: They don't give two fucks about your health. The Clinic's where they send the real hard-cases for attitude adjustment. Dubov just got sent down -- and look at Wainwright -- Toughest bastard I ever saw -- after you, of course. Now he's a fucking drool case.

question: What did he do?
answer: He hit a guard.

question: Looking for trouble, Castor?
answer: As a matter of fact -- yes.

question: Bite hard, scumbag, 'cause you'll be gumming baby food from here on out.
answer: Dubov -- come on!

question: There!
answer: Let's go! Come on... come on...

question: Last night, I thought -- this isn't my husband. Then I woke up in the middle of the night -- and found you passed out in the study.
answer: I couldn't sleep -- you roll around a lot. Anyway, I'm late.

question: Jon, you know what day it is. I know it's difficult for you, but we still have to go.
answer: Can't we skip it just this once? I gotta 'protect and serve', you know.

question: 'Protect and serve' later. You're going.
answer: Okay, if you insist. But -- you drive. So who's this Karl creep Jamie's been seeing? He's a little old for her, isn't he?

question: I don't know... they're about the same ages we were when we met. Remember the all-night dentist?
answer: Sure, how could I forget. By the way, you never said anything about last night...

question: Aren't you going to get that? Jon -- this is hardly the time or place. Happy birthday, Matty. He took our baby, Jon. He took our little boy.
answer: Stop crying... stop crying... stop ...

question: Stop crying... stop crying... stop ...
answer: You picked a helluva day to leave your beeper off!

question: What happened?
answer: Castor's dead!

question: Dr. Archer please. It's an emergency. -- Her husband. Hello, Eve -- I know this sounds crazy, but -- Dammit.
answer: How did this happen, sweetie? Get Child Services down here -- and don't let her father leave. Jon? Hello?

question: Eve, listen carefully. The man you think is your husband -- isn't.
answer: Who is this?

question: Please, just listen! Take Jamie and go to your mother's in Santa Fe. Don't tell him where you're going -- just go.
answer: Whoever you are -- don't call again...

question: I need to speak to Director Lazarro immediately... I have information about Castor Troy.
answer: This is Jon Archer. Who's calling?

question: Well, if you're Jon Archer... I guess this must be Castor Troy...
answer: I've gotta hand it to you, Jon. You're doing a damn respectable job of being me. But let's face it, we both liked it better the way it was. So before the cops blow your brains out -- why not tell me where you are...

question: If you were really me, you'd know -- no discussion, no deals. No, Jon... you have to think like Castor. Where would he go...?
answer: Jon Archer... some poor schmuck's in big trouble.

question: Yeah -- me.
answer: Jesus Christ, Castor.

question: Drive. And punch up your cellular -- I need you to make some calls.
answer: You're gonna get me busted!

question: You're already busted, Dietrich. It's just a matter of time before they pick you up.
answer: Man, when you came to me about that bomb -- I knew I should have blown you off... but that's my fucking curse -- I just can't say no to a friend.

question: You can't say no to money.
answer: That's my other curse.

question: You're Castor Troy... This is your old crew -- you don't take shit and you don't take no for an answer... Archer doesn't want you, he wants me! But I'm going to get him first -- with your help. You wanna face-off with Castor Troy? Come on, then! Come on! 'Cause I've had a real bad day... You're all forgetting who the real enemy is. Six months ago, Jon Archer hauled you in for questioning. He rattled you so bad -- you shit your Armani suit right there in the interrogation room. You laugh, Fitch -- the way Archer laughed at your last arraignment, when you got down on your knees and tried to blow your way to freedom.
answer: We all have a reason to hate Jon Archer. We all want to see him dead --

question: And nobody's untouchable if we say he's not.
answer: It's all worked out. Caz has Archer's routine down cold.

question: We start with your basic kidnapping. Then -- a little surgery. I'm going to rearrange his face in a way you won't believe.
answer: Come on -- let's drink to it! How about one of your famous toasts, Caz?

question: To old jobs, new jobs and -- uh -- blow jobs? Sorry... I don't... Sure I remember... Once a quarter, right?
answer: When even Castor Troy can't handle a tab of Quantrex... That, dear friends, is the first sorry whiff of old age.

question: No... Karl, please. My father -- he's got a gun -- he'll -- he'll --
answer: Who are you to call Jon Archer a wimp? What are you -- stupid?

question: That's just like you. Some guy tries to rape me -- and you side with him.
answer: Did it look like I was siding with him? Did it? You want to play with scummy organ grinders, you better be prepared. Do you have protection?

question: You mean like... condoms?
answer: I mean like... protection.

question: For me?
answer: Next time -- slip it in low, then twist it -- so the wound doesn't close. Go on, get out of here. No wonder he spent all his time chasing me. Who can deal with this family shit? Jon Archer. Where is he?

question: Uh -- can't we just talk?
answer: Talk? The only talk I ever heard from you was 'take it off,' 'sit on it,' 'I'll pay you tomorrow.' Take off the rest of those rags and get dressed. Then get out.

question: Not until I finish my business with your brother.
answer: I told him to keep those creeps away -- but you're just too big an attraction. Look, if the F.B.I. finds out you've been here -- I'll lose my son. So please, just go.

question: I know I've done some things that made your life harder...
answer: How would you? You walked out and never looked back.

question: I'm not the same person you remember. And for what it's worth, I'm sorry... Not a bad fit.
answer: They should. They're yours.

question: Nice-looking kid, too
answer: Of course he is... Adam, come here... I want you to meet your father.

question: How old is he?
answer: Five. No one knows you're his father. I thought someone might want to hurt him -- just to hurt you... You know Mommy doesn't like you playing with these things... You're not holding him right... Caz...

question: He's not my son.
answer: Yes, he is -- !

question: Get down!
answer: Adam! scoops up the kicked weapon -- and cold-cocks another rappelling agent. Then she FIRES, cutting a third rappelling agent's rope. he drops hard to the floor -- unconscious.

question: What the fuck do you think happened? Castor Troy just shot him! What are you waiting for? Go! What is it?
answer: We were friends once, Jon, so I feel I owe it to you -- to tell you face-to-face... I don't care how much hype you're getting -- you're through. After that massacre last night, I'm ordering a full inquiry into your recent erratic -- and deeply suspect -- behavior.

question: Me -- 'erratic'? Victor, what are you talking about?
answer: You start meeting with Brodie and Miller. Then they die mysteriously. Your best friend is murdered -- and you don't seem to give a shit. Suddenly you're smoking, drinking, acting like a man with something to hide... Maybe you've been bought -- maybe you've lost your mind. But I promise... I'm going to find out.

question: Okay, Vic, I have a confession to make. But you aren't gonna like it... I'm Castor Troy.
answer: -- I don't understand...

question: Now you understand. Cancel my four o'clock. And send for the paramedics. Victor Lazarro's having a heart attack.
answer: Commander, what are you doing here?

question: Where should I be? Where's everyone else?
answer: Backing you up! Didn't you track Castor to the Parthenia Street Terminal?

question: What?
answer: You radioed in your personal security code. Nobody knows that code but you.

question: Eve... I'm not going to hurt you. Just don't scream, okay? Okay?
answer: I know you -- you're the one who called. You're Castor Troy. You killed my son --

question: -- I called, but I'm not Castor. I'm your husband. Now, you're going to listen. The last time we saw each other -- was in this room. We had a fight after I told you I had to go away. My assignment -- Jon Archer's assignment -- was to enter a federal prison as Castor Troy.
answer: How did he expect to do that?

question: I want you guys here around-the- clock. And stay off the lawn. You're all in knots. Maybe another date night will help you relax...
answer: Not tonight... I'm way behind in my Continuing Ed.

question: You think I've been acting strange. Like a completely different person.
answer: -- Yes.

question: Okay, I have a confession to make. But you aren't going to like it... And to prove it, I'm taking you and Jamie away on a trip -- right after the memorial service.
answer: What memorial service?

question: Victor Lazarro had a heart seizure... right in my office. It was horrible...
answer: Oh, my God...

question: First Tito... now Victor... ... please don't tell me I'm going to lose you, too...
answer: Of course not.

question: What was that?
answer: What was what?

question: Something bit me.
answer: Probably a mosquito -- I'll close the window. There's been an emergency at the hospital. Fine... But please don't wake my husband... he's exhausted. Please be O-neg. Please...

question: Probably a mosquito -- I'll close the window. There's been an emergency at the hospital. Fine... But please don't wake my husband... he's exhausted. Please be O-neg. Please...
answer: Thanks for believing me. What are you doing? Where did you get that gun?

question: I took it from my fake husband.
answer: Why point it at me? I'm the real thing.

question: I don't know that. Maybe Jon's already dead.
answer: What more proof do you need?

question: Tell me... tell me about the all- night dentist.
answer: ... I took a date out for chicken and ribs -- not knowing she was a vegetarian. When the night couldn't get worse, she broke her tooth on a pebble that got into her three-bean salad Somehow she and I had fun driving around looking for an all-night dentist... And even though it must have hurt -- you still kissed me.

question: Christ, Jon! How could you put us in this position? Do you know -- do you know what he did to me...?
answer: Whatever happened, whatever he did -- I know it's my fault and I know I can never make it up to you --

question: But you're damn well going to try. First -- how are we going to get you out of this? This will knock him out for hours.
answer: Good. What's his schedule tomorrow?

question: He doesn't tell me anymore than you ever did... All I know is -- tomorrow we're going to Victor's memorial service.
answer: Victor... Tito... they both died thinking I killed them... And in a way... I did.

question: Jon -- you can't think about that now.
answer: -- What happens after the memorial?

question: He's taking Jamie and me away.
answer: And neither of you will be coming back. Where's the service?

question: Saint Mary's-By-The-Sea. What are you going to do?
answer: Hit him with a trank dart. Once he's unconscious -- I'll try to get to Buzz and Wanda before the security team gets to me.

question: What else can I do?
answer: Think up a good excuse. I don't want you or Jamie anywhere near that service.

question: I can cover for Jamie. But if I'm not there, he'll suspect something... The second you make your move, all hell's going to break loose. If I'm there beside him -- I can take charge. I'm his wife, remember? There's no way around it -- for once, you need me.
answer: I've always needed you...

question: Jon -- what are the odds?
answer: Terrible. But it's the best we can do with what we have. If it doesn't happen, take Jamie and don't look back...

question: It'll happen.
answer: Do doctors travel in packs?

question: Only when we're golfing. Jon! What are you doing here?
answer: That's what you're going to explain to me.

question: Didn't the police tell you? There was an emergency. Jon -- stop it! Mr. Alandro is very ill!
answer: Not as ill as he's going to be... Sorry. But what's a guy to think when his wife runs off in the middle of the night?

question: It's my fault. I should've woken you up before I left. Now please let me get back to work.
answer: Stay here. Watch her like a hawk. Who cares? She's going to be dead by tonight anyway. They're all going to be dead. The wife, the kid... and the father.

question: Before I turn him in, I thought we'd pay him back for everything he's put us through... Come on, baby. Join the fun -- Too bad. Part of me was hoping you didn't know. Did you really think it would be that easy, you dumb fucks? Sorry, baby. Castor Troy is about to murder you and our daughter... but I promise you won't die unavenged.
answer: This is between you and me. Leave them out of this.

question: It was between you and me. Even your little boy -- that wasn't supposed to happen. But you couldn't let it go.
answer: No father could.

question: Appealing to my sense of 'family' won't work, Jon. I thought you knew me better than that
answer: I know some things that even you don't know, Caz. You have a son. I've met him. His name is Adam...

question: Give up, Castor. People are going to find out.
answer: Not if I kill you first. Give it here, Jamie.

question: No, Jamie. Don't do it! Listen to my voice, Jamie. I'm your father.
answer: It's a trick, Jamie. I'm your father. Shoot him, Jamie.

question: Jamie...
answer: Shoot him! You dunce. No kid of mine would miss so badly.

question: Shoot him! You dunce. No kid of mine would miss so badly.
answer: Hold it.

question: Just saving the taxpayers the cost of a trial. So take a hike.
answer: You're both under arrest until a D.N.A. test proves who's who.

question: I'm ordering you to back off!
answer: Put the gun down --

question: limps away from the boatyard, towards the slips -- alive with sunbathers and yachters. FIRES -- peppering the dock.
answer: FIRES UP the second BOAT -- in pursuit. Castor BLASTS back -- SHATTERING Archer's BOAT COMPASS.

question: swerves wildly -- trying to throw Archer off. You won't shoot me, Jon. I'm unarmed...
answer: Okay, I have a confession to make... but you aren't gonna like it... You're right, I won't shoot you. Not in the face anyway.
